frameDefinitions: This frame concerns people being in an altered mental state that is induced by an Intoxicant.
A Killer or Cause causes the death of the Victim.
The existence of a State_of_affairs is sufficient reason for taking an Action .
The Sleeper stays in an altered state of consciousness with greatly reduced external awareness.
This frame concerns rituals performed in line with religious beliefs or tradition.
An Excreter excretes Excreta. 'Principal Skinner burped on me.'
frameExamples: The underwater sequences <t>warrant</t> the price of the admission alone.
In certain fertility <t>rites</t> in Burma , a woman desirous of offspring is required not only to approach the King Cobra but to plant a kiss on its mouth .
listRoleDefinitions: The mental state of the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is changed by an <fen>Intoxicant</fen> .
The <fen>Intoxicant</fen> alters the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s mental experience.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes intoxicated.
The person or sentient entity that causes the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The living entity that dies as a result of the killing.
An inanimate entity or process that causes the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The method or action that the <fen>Killer</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> performs resulting in the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The device used by the <fen>Killer</fen> to bring about the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The point or period of time within which the <fen>Victim</fen> is killed.
The location where the death took place.
An Eventuality or an Entity that is taken to constitute sufficient reason for taking another <fen>Action</fen>.
An <fen>Action</fen> that is taken to be justifiable given the <fen>State_of_Affairs</fen>.
The entity that is sleeping.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the sleep occurs.
Where the event takes place.
This is the religious or cultural leader who performs and/or leads the rite.
The role <fen>Member</fen> describes the member of the religious or cultural group who participates in/undergoes the rite.
<fen>Organization</fen> identifies the institution in which the rite is prescribed.
This role identifies the <fen>Instrument</fen> used to perform a particular rite.
This role identifies the state which the rite is hoped or intended to bring about.
The type of ritual or ceremony being performed.
This role indicates an object on which a rite is performed.
Rites may confer a <fen>New_status</fen> on a participant (e.g. rank, membership).
The <fen>Guardian</fen> is the member of the <fen>Organization</fen> who instigates the rite for someone of which they are a guardian.
When the rite is performed
Where the rite takes place.
The <fen>Excreta</fen> is the waste expelled by the body.
The <fen>Excreter</fen> is the agent who excretes the <fen>Excreta</fen>.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the starting point of the <fen>Excreta</fen>'s motion.
When the <fen>Excreter</fen> engages in excretion.
This role identifieis the <fen>Place</fen> where the excretion occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The rockslide</fex> killed nearly half of the climbers.
The flood exterminated the rats <fex>by cutting off access to food</fex>.
It's difficult to suicide <fex>with only a pocketknife</fex>.
There is no evidence that the royal family was killed <fex>during the destruction</fex> at this site.
Apparently there were two murders <fex>in Atherton</fex> in one week.
<fex>A heavy contact to the opponent 's face</fex> may not merit just a verbal warning
His baptism <fex>into the Catholic Church</fex> is scheduled for next Sunday.
Elliott was almost ordained <fex>as a priest</fex>
<fex>Mr. and Mrs. Wilson</fex> baptized their son.
Dr. Nick vomited <fex>puke</fex> across the table.

the Center for Substance Abuse Research (CESAR)
